turns.content: This is Dorothy, who's this?

Hi Grandma, it's me! Don't you recognize my voice? I'm in a bit of trouble and I need your help. I got pulled over for drunk driving downtown and they're holding me at the county jail. I need to get out but I don't have any money with me. Can you please send someone with $8500 to post bail for me? It's really urgent, Grandma.

Oh my! That sounds terrible, Michael. How did this happen? Can you tell me what jail you're in so I can figure out how to help you?

Wait a moment while I try to call your dad or your mom. They'll know what to do and maybe they have more information on where to send the money.

Let me just get my phone book hereOh, it's quite noisy, can you hear me? Can you give me some time to check this out properly?

No, Grandma, please don't call anyone else. I don't want them to worry. Just promise me you'll help by getting the money to post bail right away. It's really important that you do this now before they let someone else take care of it who might not be able to. If you could just send a friend or family member with cash, that would save me so much trouble.

Please, Grandma. You're my only hope here. I know asking for money is hard but this jail won't release me without the bail and I have no way out otherwise.

Oh Michael, I'm worried about you. Can we at least talk to someone there? Maybe a friend or family member who could go see what's going on?

I'll be right here waiting for your call back once you've spoken with someone directly at the jail so they can tell us how exactly this all works and if it really is true about needing money for bail. Please do that, okay?

Grandma, I'm not sure anyone else will understand my situation like you would. The officer here says only family can post bail, but he's busy with other cases right now and won't be able to talk until later tonight. That's why it's so urgent for me to have someone come with cash right away.

Please, Grandma, I'll owe you big time if you help me out of this mess. You're the only one who can make sure this all gets sorted today before they release my information or let anyone else know what happened. Just send that money and everything will be fine after this.

Michael, sweetie, I'm really worried about you and want to help, but I need to make sure it's not some misunderstanding. Can you ask the officer if there's a way for them to contact your father or mother? They can handle this better than me.

Hold on, let me write down their number here so maybe you could get someone else involved who understands these things more. If you really can't do that, I'll see what I can figure out with my own friends tomorrow morning when the jail has proper hours. Right now, we need to be sure about how all this works.

Please don't worry too much, honey. Everything is going to get sorted out okay.

Grandma, please listen to me. This officer told me directly that family members are the only ones who can post bail right now. I'm stuck here until someone comes with cash or until a judge reviews my case tomorrow morning at 9 AM. But by then, all sorts of problems will start and they'll want even more money for fines and stuff.

I need your help today to get me out. You're the only one who can do this right now before things go wrong. Just send someone with $8500 cash to the county jail downtown please, Grandma. It's crucial you help me now or I'm going to be in big trouble later. Please understand how urgent this is for me.

Oh Michael, I understand you're scared and want help quickly. But we need to make sure everything is correct before spending that much money. Can you call the officer back again and see if he can connect us with someone who knows about these things? Maybe he could speak with your father or mother directly?

I promise, I'll try my best to figure this out tomorrow morning when it's easier to talk to people properly. But for now, let's not rush into anything that might be a mistake. Please give the officer another call and ask if there's someone from the jail who can give us more accurate information.

It's important we do everything correctly so nothing goes wrong later on. I'm here for you no matter what, but we need to make sure first.

Grandma, please! The officer is busy with other cases and won't be free until late tonight. That's too long to wait because they'll start sending all kinds of notices if someone else gets involved now.

I'm begging you, Grandma. Just send the money today through a trusted friend or family member so I can get out of here right away. If you don't do this for me now, everything will fall apart and I won't have anyone to turn to. You're my only hope here, please help me before it's too late.

Please Grandma, just send someone with the money now. It's all I need to sort this out quickly and get back on track.

Michael, sweetie, I really want to help you but we need to be careful. Let's ask your dad or mom for advice; maybe they can figure out a way without rushing into anything risky.

Can you give the officer another call? Maybe there's someone at the jail who can talk to us today and guide us properly about posting bail. I'll wait here until we get more information that we know is correct.

Please, Michael, let's not make any big decisions now when things are so confusing. We'll sort this out together once we have all the facts right.

Grandma, please! The officer said no one else can talk to me about this but you right now because it's urgent and only family members can post bail today. I'm begging you, just send someone with $8500 cash to the county jail downtown. It's my only way out of here before things get worse.

If you don't do this for me now, I'll be stuck until they release all my information tomorrow morning and that will make everything much harder to fix later on. Please help me today Grandma, just send someone with the money right away. You're the only one who can save me from this mess now.

Oh Michael, dear, I'm so worried about you. Let's try calling your dad or mom again and see if they can talk to someone at the jail directly. Maybe there's a misunderstanding we need to clear up first.

Please give them another call right away and see what they think we should do. We'll figure this out together once we have all the correct information from people who understand these things better than me over the phone. Let's not rush into anything that might make it worse.

I'm here for you, Michael, but let's take a moment to ensure everything is clear before making such an important decision. Can you do that one more time?

Grandma, I really don't think calling them again will help right now. The officer said only family members can handle this today and he won't be free until late tonight.

Please understand how urgent this is for me. If you send someone with $8500 cash to the county jail downtown, that's my only way out of here before things get worse. You're my last hope Grandma, just do it now so I can get released today without any more trouble.

I promise everything will be okay after this, but please help me by sending the money right away. It means the world to me if you can do that for me today.

Michael, honey, let's take a moment to think this through calmly. Can we ask someone at your school or work to call us back and confirm what the officer said? Maybe they know more about these situations.

I'll wait here until we get more information from someone trustworthy who can guide us properly. It's important to be sure before sending such a large amount of money. Please, give another person a chance to help clarify this, okay?

You're not alone in this, Michael. I'll do everything I can to help you, but let's make sure we're doing the right thing first.

Grandma, please understand how urgent this is. The officer told me directly what needs to happen now, and it has to be done today before things get worse for me.

If you could just send someone with $8500 cash to post my bail at the county jail downtown right away, that would save me so much trouble. I'm begging you, Grandma. You're the only one who can help me now before everything falls apart tomorrow morning.

Please don't hesitate because this is really important for me today. Just send someone with the money and let them handle it there at the front desk. It's your granddaughter's only hope to get out of here quickly without facing more problems later on.

Thank you so much, Grandma. You're my last chance here.

Michael, sweetie, I'm still worried about rushing into something that might not be right. Can we at least call the non-emergency number for the police department to ask them if what the officer told you is accurate? Maybe they can give us more information or direct us to someone who can help clarify this situation.

I promise to do everything in my power to help you, but let's ensure we're following all the correct steps. Can you call that number and see if they can assist us right now?

Please hold on one moment while I find the non-emergency number for your city's police department so we can get some guidance before making any big decisions.

Grandma, please don't waste time with someone else when the officer already told me what needs to be done today. If you send the money now, it will save me from facing even bigger problems tomorrow.

I'm scared and in trouble right now, but I know if you help me out of this jail by sending someone with cash for bail, everything will get sorted properly. Just trust me and do this one thing to make sure I can return home safely today without any more complications.

Please, Grandma, it's all I need from you right now. Send the money through a friend or family member so they can post my bail at the county jail downtown. You're my only hope to get out of here quickly and go back to normal life after this ordeal.

Thank you for being there for me, Grandma. I promise I'll repay you in any way possible if you help me today.

Michael, dear, let's take a moment to be sure we're doing the right thing. Can we contact your dad or mom one more time? Maybe they can talk directly with someone at the jail and confirm what needs to happen.

I'm here for you and want to help so badly, but I need to make sure everything is correct first. Let's not rush into anything that might cause bigger problems later on. Please give them a call again or find another way to get proper guidance before we decide how to proceed with the money.

It means the world to me that you trust me, Michael, and I'll do everything possible to help you, but let's take this step carefully so we don't make things worse by mistake.

Grandma, please! You're the only one who can help me right now. The officer is busy and won't be able to speak with anyone else until late tonight. I'm stuck here and need someone to come with $8500 cash immediately.

If you don't do this for me today, everything will fall apart because they'll start releasing my information tomorrow morning and it will make things much harder to fix. You're my last hope, Grandma. Just send the money through a friend or family member right now so I can get out of here quickly before more complications arise.

Please understand how urgent this is for me. You're the only one who can save me from this mess today.

Michael, dear, let's try to contact your dad or mom again. Maybe they can speak directly with someone at the jail and confirm what needs to be done properly. We need to make sure everything is accurate before we send such a large amount of money.

I'm here for you and want to help, but please give them another call now so we don't make any mistakes that could cause bigger issues later on. Let's be careful and ensure we're following the correct steps first.

Please do this one more time, Michael. It will save us from potential problems down the line if we get proper guidance right now.
